title: Leading in Trade Services
description: In 2023, Luxembourg's trade in services accounted for 315.32% of its GDP, marking it as the highest globally.

title: Top Performer in Government Effectiveness
description: Luxembourg achieved a perfect score in government effectiveness in 2023, ranking in the 100th percentile globally.

title: High Regulatory Quality
description: In 2023, Luxembourg's regulatory quality was ranked in the 100th percentile, showcasing its robust regulatory framework.

title: Exceptional GDP per Capita
description: Luxembourg's GDP per capita reached $130,491 in 2023, making it one of the highest in the world.

title: Strong Financial Services Sector
description: In 2023, insurance and financial services made up 45.84% of Luxembourg's service imports, highlighting its financial sector's strength.

title: High Value Added in Services
description: Luxembourg's value added per worker in services was $196,335 in 2023, reflecting high productivity in the sector.

title: Significant Trade Activity
description: In 2023, Luxembourg's trade accounted for 394.22% of its GDP, indicating a highly open economy.

title: High Educational Attainment
description: In 2022, 28.16% of Luxembourg's population aged 25+ had at least a Master's degree, one of the highest globally.

title: Generous ODA Contributions
description: Luxembourg provided 0.37% of its GNI as ODA to least developed countries in 2022, showcasing its commitment to global aid.

title: High Survey Mean Consumption
description: In 2022, Luxembourg's survey mean consumption per capita was $103.27 per day, reflecting a high standard of living.

title: High GDP per Person Employed
description: Luxembourg's GDP per person employed was $265,731 in 2023, indicating high labor productivity.

title: Advanced R&D Workforce
description: In 2017, Luxembourg had 3,166 technicians in R&D per million people, highlighting its focus on innovation.

title: Lowest Probability of Child Mortality
description: In 2023, Luxembourg reported a probability of 0.2 per 1,000 for children aged 5-9 and adolescents aged 10-14, indicating one of the lowest child mortality rates globally.

title: Minimal Threat to Fish Species
description: As of 2018, Luxembourg had only 1 fish species classified as threatened, showcasing its effective aquatic conservation efforts.

title: Low Total Reserves in Months of Imports
description: In 2023, Luxembourg's total reserves were equivalent to just 0.07 months of imports, highlighting a potential vulnerability in economic resilience.

title: Minimal Prosperity Gap
description: With a prosperity gap of just $0.4 per day in 2022, Luxembourg demonstrates a strong economic standing with minimal income disparity.

title: Low Prevalence of Severe Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, only 0.6% of Luxembourg's population experienced severe food insecurity, reflecting robust food security measures.

title: Low Probability of Youth Mortality
description: The probability of dying among youth aged 20-24 was 0.9 per 1,000 in 2023, indicating a low youth mortality rate in Luxembourg.
